publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5720 Margaret Jamieson: Myasthenia Gravis Association—That the Parliament recognises the work that the Myasthenia Gravis Association does to raise awareness of myasthenia gravis, an auto immune disease which is characterised by fluctuating, sometimes fatal, muscle weakness and which, it is estimated, affects one in every 10,000 people in Scotland, and the work it does to raise the funds needed to support sufferers and fund research.
S2M-5720 Myasthenia Gravis Association (lodged on 7 March 2007) Mr David Davidson*, Alex Neil*

S2M-5720 Margaret Jamieson: Myasthenia Gravis Association—That the Parliament recognises the work that the Myasthenia Gravis Association does to raise awareness of myasthenia gravis, an auto immune disease which is characterised by fluctuating, sometimes fatal, muscle weakness and which, it is estimated, affects one in every 10,000 people in Scotland, and the work it does to raise the funds needed to support sufferers and fund research. Supported by: Mr David Davidson, Alex Neil
S2M-5720 Myasthenia Gravis Association (lodged on 7 March 2007) Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-5720 Myasthenia Gravis Association (lodged on 7 March 2007) Maureen Macmillan*

S2M-5720 Margaret Jamieson: Myasthenia Gravis Association—That the Parliament recognises the work that the Myasthenia Gravis Association does to raise awareness of myasthenia gravis, an auto immune disease which is characterised by fluctuating, sometimes fatal, muscle weakness and which, it is estimated, affects one in every 10,000 people in Scotland, and the work it does to raise the funds needed to support sufferers and fund research. Supported by: Mr David Davidson, Alex Neil, Mr Adam Ingram, Maureen Macmillan
